parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
